definition: to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: I do my own mental work and heal myself.
sentences.chinese: 我僅專注自己的心智修練和療愈自己。

sentences.english: Is your spouse a Vipassana meditator in this tradition?
sentences.chinese: 您的配偶是否也修練這種內觀法？

sentences.english: Practice without companion of five subjects is unworthy being done so hard.
sentences.chinese: 沒有五明伴隨的修練是不值得那麼辛苦的。

sentences.english: Life is a long road waits for our intrinsic heart to explore.
sentences.chinese: 人生修練是一條漫長的路等我們內在的心去探索。

sentences.english: Society ought to promote the exercise of virtue, not obstruct it.
sentences.chinese: 社會應讓人們容易地修練德行，勿橫加障礙。

sentences.english: Practices nei-tan work is taoists achieve immortality is the only way to attain.
sentences.chinese: 修練內丹功是道教徒達到成仙得道的唯一途徑。

definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
to come to understand/to realize/consciousness/awareness/Buddhist enlightenment (Sanskrit: cittotpāda)
sect/school (group of followers of a particular doctrine)
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
